description:
With more than 80 years of experience in the assessment field, Pearson's Clinical Assessment group offers a comprehensive portfolio of research-based instruments that are valid, reliable, and represent the highest technical quality in assessments today. We are particularly noted for our proven and trusted assessment contributions in cognitive ability, memory, neuropsychology, behavior, personality/psychopathology, achievement, and speech/language. Pearson is proud of its support of pharmaceutical research through licensing of our internationally recognized assessments. The Director of Sales (Pharma) is an experienced business development leader within a National, Continental, and/or Global territory focused on new business acquisition and expansion sales growth streams. This senior leader is responsible for driving financially sustainable revenue growth with direct customers while building relationships for licensing and partnering opportunities. This role will also be responsible for strategy, planning, and team management. Scope of Work (Include % of the time if appropriate) Direct and oversee the Pharma business development strategy to identify, develop and sign new customers for products and services. Work with the business development team, operations, contracts and licensing, vendor management, and finance leaders to develop multi-year growth and profit plans Effectively build and manage relationships with multiple partners, acting as a senior leader and as a trusted, strategic advisor. Oversee a business development team of up to 5 people, to ensure solid market relationships in place to foster the growth of programs and new partners, in addition to expansion and renewal of current customers Partner with peers across our matrixed organization to create consistent practices and approaches to drive results. Ensure a world-class, winning team is in place who are effective in strategic account management and business development Anticipate future talent needs and ensure talent identification, development, and retention strategies are successfully designed and implemented. Foster a success-oriented, results-driven, and accountable environment, and provide day-to-day leadership that mirrors the strategy, mission, and core values of Pearson. Develop relationships across broader Pearson to ensure we bring to bear the products and capabilities of our pharma business to a global level Establish contacts within CNS (Central Nervous System) and selected other therapeutic groups of major pharmaceutical companies, biotech companies, Clinical Research Organizations (CRO's), and rater services companies. Identify innovations, new products, and new services that may be important to our customers and partners, and work with peers to identify new operational infrastructure (systems, processes, and/or personnel) required to deliver on these. In partnership with Finance and the use of Salesforce develop P&L models and forecasting for new partner and program opportunities. Establish and implement short- and long-range goals, objectives, policies, and operating procedures Sell Pearson's Pharma Research Services to assigned potential and existing accounts. Meet or Exceed Assigned Quotas Demonstrate consistent and effective pipeline management Establish contacts within CNS (Central Nervous System) and selected other therapeutic groups of major pharmaceutical companies, biotech companies, Clinical Research Organizations (CRO's), and rater services companies. Act as the primary account management contact for selected key accounts. Develop and implement account strategies that incorporate account profiling with lead generation, , business development and retention strategies. Generate and process proposals, collaborate with other departments within Pearson The anticipated starting salary range for Colorado-based individuals expressing interest in this position is $100k-125k. This position is eligible to participate in a sales incentive plan.Benefits available to eligible employees . Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities 10 years of business development, solution selling, and/or external client/partner management, preferably with clinical assessment knowledge. Demonstrated success at developing and implementing integrated strategies and programs which deliver results in alignment with overall business objectives. An exceptional relationship builder/influencer with a proven track record of effectively managing a diverse stakeholder group in a complex enterprise and executing on strategies to deliver superior results in both the short and long term. Strong executive presence, adept at interaction with a diverse group of internal clients along with senior executives of partner institutions Demonstrated ability to lead people and get results through influencing others. Proven success in a matrix management environment. Enthusiasm and the ability to thrive in an atmosphere of constant change. Excellent judgement, intellectual ability, and leadership skills with high integrity Well-developed commercial and business acumen Strong strategic consulting skills and experience Excellent communication skills for effective contact and presentation with executive stakeholders at university partners and across Pearson Strong analytical skills, with a track record of developing actionable recommendations from quantitative data Advanced degree or PhD preferable. Experience in selling intangibles - selling solutions vs. products; sales process focused Hands-on leader with a high degree of personal accountability and integrity Territory management expertise Excellent negotiation skills and experience developing and structuring agreements to support Clinical Assessments and partner objectives Results-oriented professional with strong work ethic. Demonstrated success working independently, working from home Travel The position requires a willingness to travel up to 30% of the time, contingent upon environmental and societal impacts. The position also requires that the individual be comfortable in a relatively independent working environment, with primary contact with team members being virtual. Travel to meet with team members for joint customer visits, performance coaching and development, strategic planning, and conferences/ territory events Reporting structure This position will report directly to the VP, Sales Clinical Assessment
Salary Range:
$100K -- $150K

Business DevelopmentEstimated Salary: $20 to $28 per hour based on qualifications.
